availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Brassfield Lander (Christian County, hopkins County, blacksmith)

body.p: Christian County and Hopkins County, Kentucky, blacksmith. Kentucky native. Married to Catherine T. Smoot Lander in Christian County, Kentucky, on January 26, 1842. Father of Lucy A. Lander, Elizabeth J. Lander, George W. Lander, Thomas T. Lander, John B. Lander, Otho G. Lander, Lena K. Lander, and Maggie B. Lander. Blacksmith in Christian County in 1850. Blacksmith in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 1, p. 459B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 638.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 3, p. 509A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Christian County Marriages, Film #000465562, p. 29.
"William Brassfield Lander (1823-1898)," Find A Grave, Memorial #33172450, accessed October 13, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/33172450.
